text: Badminton at the 2005 Southeast Asian Games was held at the PhilSports Arena (formerly ULTRA Arena) at the Philippine Sports Commission Complex in Pasig City, Philippines. Participants competed for 5 gold medals in the Individual Events and 2 gold medals in the Team Events. ==Medal winners== {| |- |rowspan=2| Men's singles |rowspan=2| |rowspan=2| | |- | |- |rowspan=2| Women's singles |rowspan=2| |rowspan=2| | |- | |- |rowspan=2| Men's doubles |rowspan=2| Markis Kido Hendra Setiawan |rowspan=2| Luluk Hadiyanto Alvent Yulianto Chandra | Choong Tan Fook Wong Choong Hann |- | Chan Chong Ming Koo Kien Keat |- |rowspan=2| Women's doubles |rowspan=2| Wong Pei Tty Chin Eei Hui |rowspan=2| Jo Novita Greysia Polii | Jiang Yanmei Li Yujia |- | Saralee Thungthongkam Satinee Jankrajangwong |- |rowspan=2| Mixed doubles |rowspan=2| Nova Widianto Lilyana Natsir |rowspan=2| Anggun Nugroho Yunita Tetty | Hendry Kurniawan Saputra Li Yujia |- | Koo Kien Keat Wong Pei Tty |- |rowspan=2| Men's team |rowspan=2| Lee Chong Wei Muhd Hafiz Hashim Kuan Beng Hong Choong Tan Fook Wong Choong Hann Chan Chong Ming Koo Kien Keat Lee Wan Wah |rowspan=2| Taufik Hidayat Sony Dwi Kuncoro Simon Santoso Luluk Hadiyanto Alvent Yulianto Chandra Hendra Setiawan Markis Kido Anggun Nugroho Nova Widianto | Boonsak Ponsana Poompat Sapkulchananart Jakrapan Thanathiratham Sudket Prapakamol Patapol Ngernsrisuk Nitipong Saengsila Songphon Anugritayawon |- | Nguyễn Tiến Minh Nguyễn Hoàng Hải Nguyễn Quang Phong Trần Thanh Hải Nguyễn Quang Minh |- |rowspan=2| Women's team |rowspan=2| Salakjit Ponsana Monthila Meemek Soratja Chansrisukot Saralee Thungthongkam Satinee Jankrajangwong Kunchala Voravichitchaikul Sujitra Ekmongkolpaisarn Sirivannavari Nariratana |rowspan=2| Li Li Xing Aiying Jiang Yanmei Li Yujia Liu Fan Frances Shinta Mulia Sari | Adriyanti Firdasari Fransisca Ratnasari Maria Kristin Yulianti Jo Novita Greysia Polii Lita Nurlita Natalia Poluakan Yunita Tetty Liliyana Natsir |- | Wong Mew Choo M.
